markdown.headingText: Display cards in a row using the card_row function
markdown.markdown:
```{r}
#| include: false
library(dashboardr)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(htmltools)
library(dashboardr)

mario_card <- card(
  content = "Mario il Gatto is a data scientist who believes that every dataset has a soul and that R is the language of the gods. He spends his days making beautiful visualizations and his nights dreaming of perfectly normalized databases.",
  title = "Mario il Gatto",
  image = "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1514888286974-6c03e2ca1dba?w=300&h=200&fit=crop",
  image_alt = "Photo of a majestic orange cat",
  footer = "Website: mario-il-gatto.data",
  class = "mb-3"
)

giuseppe_card <- card(
  content = "Giuseppe il Cane is a machine learning engineer who thinks that neural networks are just very complicated dogs. He's convinced that every algorithm needs a good walk and that overfitting is just a sign of too much enthusiasm.",
  title = "Giuseppe il Cane",
  image = "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552053831-71594a27632d?w=300&h=200&fit=crop",
  image_alt = "Photo of a happy golden retriever",
  footer = "Website: giuseppe-il-cane.ai",
  class = "mb-3"
)

card_row(mario_card, giuseppe_card)
```
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
```{r}
#| include: false
library(dashboardr)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(htmltools)
library(dashboardr)

mario_card <- card(
  content = "Mario il Gatto is a data scientist who believes that every dataset has a soul and that R is the language of the gods. He spends his days making beautiful visualizations and his nights dreaming of perfectly normalized databases.",
  title = "Mario il Gatto",
  image = "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1514888286974-6c03e2ca1dba?w=300&h=200&fit=crop",
  image_alt = "Photo of a majestic orange cat",
  footer = "Website: mario-il-gatto.data",
  class = "mb-3"
)

giuseppe_card <- card(
  content = "Giuseppe il Cane is a machine learning engineer who thinks that neural networks are just very complicated dogs. He's convinced that every algorithm needs a good walk and that overfitting is just a sign of too much enthusiasm.",
  title = "Giuseppe il Cane",
  image = "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552053831-71594a27632d?w=300&h=200&fit=crop",
  image_alt = "Photo of a happy golden retriever",
  footer = "Website: giuseppe-il-cane.ai",
  class = "mb-3"
)

# Display cards in a row using the card_row function
card_row(mario_card, giuseppe_card)
```

include-in-header.text:
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Fira+Sans:wght@300;400;500;600;700&family=Fira+Code:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">

include-after-body.text:
<script>
  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function () {
      var toc = document.createElement("div");
      toc.id = "custom-toc";
      toc.style.position = "fixed";
      toc.style.top = "0";
      toc.style.right = "-300px";
      toc.style.width = "260px";
      toc.style.height = "100%";
      toc.style.background = "white";
      toc.style.padding = "10px";
      toc.style.boxShadow = "0px 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2)";
      toc.style.transition = "right 0.3s ease-in-out";
      toc.style.overflowY = "auto";
      toc.style.zIndex = "999";
  
      var tocTitle = document.createElement("h3");
      tocTitle.innerText = "Navigation";
      toc.appendChild(tocTitle);
  
      var headers = document.querySelectorAll("h2, h3, h4");
      headers.forEach(function (header, index) {
          if (!header.id) {
              header.id = "section-" + index;
          }
  
          var link = document.createElement("a");
          link.innerText = header.innerText;
          link.href = "#" + header.id;
          link.style.display = "block";
          link.style.padding = "5px 0";
          link.style.color = "#007bff";
          link.style.textDecoration = "none";
  
          toc.appendChild(link);
      });
  
      document.body.appendChild(toc);
  
      var button = document.createElement("button");
      button.id = "toggle-toc";
      button.innerHTML = "ðŸ“‘";
      button.style.position = "fixed";
      button.style.top = "15px";
      button.style.right = "15px";
      button.style.backgroundColor = "white";
      button.style.color = "#333";
      button.style.border = "2px solid #ccc";
      button.style.padding = "10px 12px";
      button.style.cursor = "pointer";
      button.style.borderRadius = "8px";
      button.style.fontSize = "22px";
      button.style.zIndex = "1000";
      button.style.boxShadow = "0px 3px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2)";
      button.style.width = "50px";
      button.style.height = "50px";
  
      document.body.appendChild(button);
  
      button.addEventListener("click", function () {
          if (toc.style.right === "0px") {
              toc.style.right = "-300px";
          } else {
              toc.style.right = "0px";
          }
      });
  });
</script>
